channel.title: Dragon Claws[V2.1]
channel.description:
Well, I've had a bit of a break from modeling lately so I figured why not start of with something simple? here are my D claws. Nothing great, but with the recently dead model section, I don't see how you can complain with anything thats not a recolor. :P [b]New Download[/b] http://uppit.com/doui08o1tpie/Dragon_Claws_2.1_-_Dylan.RAR
[IMG]http://i369.photobucket.com/albums/oo131/0xXDylanXx0/dclaws.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i369.photobucket.com/albums/oo131/0xXDylanXx0/dclaws2.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i369.photobucket.com/albums/oo131/0xXDylanXx0/wffff.jpg[/img]
D Claws Version 2.0 [IMG]http://i369.photobucket.com/albums/oo131/0xXDylanXx0/dclaws2-1.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i369.photobucket.com/albums/oo131/0xXDylanXx0/dclaws2-1.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i369.photobucket.com/albums/oo131/0xXDylanXx0/newdclaw.jpg[/img]
EDIT: Sorry for the horrid pics. The BG went black and messed everything up. Heres some blender rendering: [IMG]http://i369.photobucket.com/albums/oo131/0xXDylanXx0/dclaaw2.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i369.photobucket.com/albums/oo131/0xXDylanXx0/dclaaw.jpg[/img]
INTS: [code]anInt389 = 612 anInt395 = 2160[/code]

item.title: Dragon Claws[V2.1]
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

And? It was constructive criticism. We all know that hands in RS are spherical, but that doesn’t mean the model has to accommodate for that. Besides, if you were to actually look at some of the glove models in RS now, quite a few of them actually look like a modeled hand or fist, not just a sphere.

Read full topic

It’s a bit messy. Good concept though.

Messy how? Poly wise its very clean. Do you mean by the design itself?
[/quote]The way how it looks like you got a sphere and just stuck it down there. it makes the faces look messy because the lines showed though the V thing.[/quote]this is a big gravedig but im like these claws so i came to the post again but in runescape and rsps’s your hands are sphericle

item.title: Dragon Claws[V2.1]
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“dylan_0789, post:48, topic:344765”]They are animated. Thanks everyone.
Also, Rip4d I posted this on Rune Server and someone requested an ingame ss of it. I used your clip and credited you for the clip. I’ll take it down if you don’t want it up there.[/quote]Dont worry, you can leave it up

Read full topic

item.title: Dragon Claws[V2.1]
item.dc:creator: @staypuff staypuff
item.description:
@staypuff wrote:

[quote=“dylan_0789, post:52, topic:344765”][quote author=staypuff link=topic=441140.msg3243178#msg3243178 date=1277098931]
ok i got them working in game… but i have to say they would look alot better without the arm coverage. Is there anyway i can delete the top part of it and keep it animated?
[/quote]
No. you need to convert it to meta then delete arm coverage. Btw: the claws intended to act as the glove too. Plus, the arm guard would realistically act as a defense mechanism aswell as keep support the arm. Think of it like this: if you used a claw in real life just holding it with a little bar as a handle vs. a full guard one, yours would leave a few scratches because there would be no weight behind the swing. Then again, this IS runescape :P[/quote]

I agree with your thinking its just that with them, the armour and outfits that match or go with it become very limited and the freedom to create many cool suits is one of the better features of rs

Read full topic

item.title: Dragon Claws[V2.1]
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

staypuff:

ok i got them working in game… but i have to say they would look alot better without the arm coverage. Is there anyway i can delete the top part of it and keep it animated?

No. you need to convert it to meta then delete arm coverage. Btw: the claws intended to act as the glove too. Plus, the arm guard would realistically act as a defense mechanism aswell as keep support the arm. Think of it like this: if you used a claw in real life just holding it with a little bar as a handle vs. a full guard one, yours would leave a few scratches because there would be no weight behind the swing. Then again, this IS runescape

Read full topic
